title: [UX] No connection log when a validator connect to a beacon-chain node
body:
# üêû Bug Report ### Description No logs of connection are shown from a beacon-chain journal when a validator connects to a beacon-chain node while there is an indication of connection/disconnection for a network peer at the same level of verbosity when syncing. ### Has this worked before in a previous version? Not sure. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Beacon-chain: 
  docker run -d -u `id -u` -v `pwd`/prysm-beacon:/data -p '0.0.0.0:4000:4000' gcr.io/prysmaticlabs/prysm/beacon-chain:latest --datadir=/data --log-file=/data/beacon-1.log
Validator: 
  docker run -d -u `id -u` -v `pwd`/prysm-data:/data gcr.io/prysmaticlabs/prysm/validator:latest --datadir=/data --log-file=/data/validator-1.log --keymanager=keystore --keymanageropts '{ "path": "/data", "passphrase": "changeme" }' --beacon-rpc-provider $BEACON_HOST:4000
## üî• Error No error. ## üåç Your Environment **Operating System:** 
  
NixOS
**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)** 
  
time="2020-04-27 11:18:06" level=info msg="Starting beacon node" prefix=node version="Prysm/Git commit: eb5513f8c209c6f1254f9cc311202f59c3570d3e. Built at: 2020-04-27 07:06:03+00:00"

time="2020-04-27 11:32:09" level=info msg="Processing block 18277/68260 - estimated time remaining 23m54s" blocksPerSecond=34.9 peers=11 prefix=initial-sync

I'm not sure we want to support this, at least at INFO level. Given that the API is stateless and the validator client has the option to load balance between many beacon nodes, I think this type of functionality will only create noise in the logs, especially if validators are bouncing between beacon nodes.

That makes senses, I opened it as a bug because from a network standpoint, I was surprised to see other software connecting in logs while not seeing the validator connecting.
The context was that I was trying to help a user to know if its validator was well connected to its local beacon-chain or not.

I'm not totally opposed to adding this. It isn't a feature that I would use but if there is user interest then I think we can add it, as long as it can be disabled with a flag. (--disable-validator-connection-logs) or something like that.

Hi @prestonvanloon, I'll work on it 
Can you please assign it to me?
Please finish your other assigned issues before picking up another one. #5450 #5439
